title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez pleaded guilty to bank fraud and mail theft in November 2025.
Rios-Franco was sentenced to 35 months in prison and ordered to pay $12,528 in restitution.
The scheme involved stealing checks from USPS boxes, altering them, and redepositing into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen detained by ICE in 2025, has been invited to the State of the Union.
Rep. Seth Moulton, who invited Gomes, said his story highlights issues within the U.S. immigration system.
Gomes was detained last May while driving his father's car; ICE targeted his father for arrest.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a regrettable center-ice goal in Team USA's Olympic win over Denmark.
Swayman laughed off his performance, jokingly blaming colorblindness for missing the puck during the game.
Despite Swayman's two miscues, the U.S. team secured a victory with robust offensive support.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: NBA stars including Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony discuss Jayson Tatum's potential return from his Achilles injury.
Kevin Durant shares expectations of All-Star level play from Jayson Tatum, drawing from his own Achilles recovery experience.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's limited minutes return will enhance the Celtics' playoff prospects without disrupting the current lineup.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have $41 million in cap space entering the offseason to add impactful free agents.
Alec Pierce and Jaelan Phillips are key potential acquisitions, fulfilling wide receiver and edge rusher needs.
Offensive line improvements are possible through free agents Rasheed Walker and Connor McGovern.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes MLB.TV's new streaming home with a partnership offering MLB.TV as an add-on to ESPN Unlimited.
MLB.TV costs $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers and $149.99 for non-subscribers, including a free month trial of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers are renewed automatically, with optional ESPN Unlimited trial; new users must register via the ESPN app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League affiliate, sparking speculation about a possible return.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's progress, noting he looked like himself in practice.
Celtics president Brad Stevens emphasized Tatum will not return until fully ready, following his Achilles injury last May.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the nation according to WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
The state leads with over 47% of adults holding a bachelor's degree and nearly 22% holding advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland follow Massachusetts in educational rankings, while West Virginia ranks last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner baseball card from the early 1900s is up for auction, managed by Ken Goldin.
The T206 Wagner card was initially discovered by Morton Bernstein and has remained in his family for 116 years.
Current bidding for the Wagner card stands at $3.9 million, with a potential selling price of $4.758 million factoring in fees.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut starting for Team USA against Denmark on Saturday.
The 27-year-old Bruins goalie previously helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Swayman joins Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy on Team USA's ice for the Olympic preliminary round.
